bug.short_desc: PDF: Paragraph Breaks are Missing around Tables, Images

long_desc.thetext:
The PDF version of the manual suffers from the fact that images and tables are not separated from the rest of the text, leading to ugly side-by-side layouts.
This particularly affects cases where a section heading is followed by a table; the heading is displayed left of the table, instead above (example: WYSIWYG editors). It is unclear to me how to fix this.
The whole chapter about the standard apps shows the image - text problem.
One example for the table issue is p.161, the overview of WYSIWYG HTML editors.

There are more examples of this issue in the widget reference list, beginning on page 335. One of the affected files is widget/atom.rst.
It turns out that LaTeX does not assign a style suitable for headings to deeply nested rST headings such as "Atom" in atom.rst. This becomes obvious if you remove the heading from the file widget/toctree.rst that includes widget/atom.rst. In this case headings are correctly followed by a line-break.
widget/atom.rst
Atom ****
In qooxdoo.tex generated by make latex the heading becomes:
\subparagraph{Atom}
A possible fix might be to change the visual representation of the LaTeX subparagraph by overwriting the \subparagraph command. There may be hooks in rST to accomplish that.
